meanings.definition: The quality or state of being sparse.
meanings.sent1: The sparsenesses of trees in the desert made the landscape seem empty.
meanings.sent2: The sparsenesses of stars in the sky allowed the moon to shine brightly.
meanings.sent3: The sparsenesses of toppings on the pizza made it look like a plain bread.
meanings.sent4: The sparsenesses of laughter in the room felt like a heavy silence.
meanings.sent5: The sparsenesses of colors in the painting created a sense of calmness.

meanings.definition: The condition of being thinly dispersed or scattered.
meanings.sent1: The sparsenesses of seeds in the field led to uneven growth.
meanings.sent2: The sparsenesses of clouds in the sky allowed the sun to peek through.
meanings.sent3: The sparsenesses of toys in the playroom made it easy to clean up.
meanings.sent4: The sparsenesses of footsteps in the hallway hinted at a ghostly presence.
meanings.sent5: The sparsenesses of applause in the auditorium echoed softly.

meanings.definition: The lack of density or abundance.
meanings.sent1: The sparsenesses of leaves on the tree signaled the arrival of autumn.
meanings.sent2: The sparsenesses of fish in the pond made fishing challenging.
meanings.sent3: The sparsenesses of words in his speech left the audience puzzled.
meanings.sent4: The sparsenesses of customers in the store made it easy to browse.
meanings.sent5: The sparsenesses of stars in the city sky revealed the beauty of the night.
